page.title: 07JERSEY ROYAL POTATO (1)
page.content:
The Jersey Royal potato year starts in October. The seed potatoes, which were harvested at the end of June,and tipped into trays in lofts and sheds with plenty of ventilation, are now graded into four sizes. Each potato has its shoots broken off, and they are then 'stood' individually in trays, which are stacked in single rows to allow light and ventilation to ensure even growth of the new young shoots.
In January or early February the fields are ploughed to clean them, and fertilizer is evenly spread over them. The soil is then broken up into a fine tilth before the potatoes are planted (in February), and the fields are then sprayed to prevent weeds growing.
